text: Produce great men, the rest follows.
author: Walt Whitman

text: Wives are young men's mistresses, companions for middle age, and old men's nurses.
author: Francis Bacon

text: All men having power ought to be distrusted to a certain degree.
author: James Madison

text: Great men are like eagles, and build their nest on some lofty solitude.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: Such is the nature of men, that howsoever they may acknowledge many others to be more witty, or more eloquent, or more learned yet they will hardly believe there be many so wise as themselves.
author: Thomas Hobbes
